reviewText: I love this documentary but there is a part at the end with the narrator that I feel is to over dramatic. :-)

This is the only DVD I know describing the Azusa Street Revival. This is a very rare item that will someday be absolutely priceless. I will keep it forever and pass it on to my children. These Azusa Street items are going to be extremely rare as time goes by. If you belong to one of the denominations that were birthed at Azusa Street, you absolutely should have this.
GOOD OVERVIEW OF THE AZUSA STREET REVIVAL-FEEL THAT PART 2 SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN THE OFFERING. IT IS A GOOD START OF GAINING AN UNDERSTANDING OF THIS EVENT.

17 years ago, I walked into a small church, called up onstage, pastor prayed and my leg, that was about one inch shorter than the other, instantly grew out to meet the others length. Also, at this same church, I witnessed the singing in tounges or "heavenly chorus" mentioned in this film, though at the time, I had no idea what it was until viewing this documentary. After witnessing a miracle on myself and the singing in tounges in person. There's no doubt in my mind that everything else in this documentary is true and correct. When God moves...it's great!
In my opinion, this is a fair review of the events concerning the main leaders of the Azusa Street Revival.  I like the pacing, and the illustrations are excellent.

This DVD gives historical and biographical information about beginnings of the Pentecostal movement in the United States.  A variety of well-documented film clips and photographs of events that occurred during the twentieth century are included as the movement took place.
Excellent read!
Can't wait for the Part 2!

We had watched this on TV but the DVD of it was much better quality.  If I had any complaint it would be not be about this particular product; but that any kind of video production that has music to it the background music always seems to be too loud, making it more difficult to hear the what the speakers are saying.  That is the fault of the film makers and directors making the film and not the DVD itself.  It was much better quality that what was on TV; but I would just like for all film makers to get the word that they need to turn the background music down when making movies or video of any kind.  If you have an interest in how the pentecostal movement had it's beginning in the United States in the early 1900's you will enjoy this DVD.
Well done.
good!!
Okay, but seems from a biased point of view.  The start of Charismatic movement.
Awesome!
A true Blessing!
most excellent

To anyone who believes in the infilling of the Holy Spirit I highly recommend this DVD.  THE AZUSA STREET PROJECT is an important part of our history that  should never be forgotten.  I found this DVD to be incouraging and a reminder of how it all began with 120 people in an upper room and He didn't stop there.  God is STILL moving in the lives of His people.  I highly recommend this DVD
Very informative for those who are seeking their 20th century Pentecostal roots.
Good DVD

I thoroughly enjoyed the documentary. It caused me to want to know more about the Pentecostal movement (the working of the Holy Spirit) in this country. In my pursuit for more information I found this documentary on YouTube; free, no cost. I don't regret renting it and will share it with others, who may readily click on to view it free.
I was rather disappointed to find that due to dissension the movement of the Holy Spirit through Elder Seymour was stymied after the 3 years of revival. But thank God the many lives that were changed remains and millions of names have been written in heaven because of the Azusa Street Revival.
Loved the presentation
this story was great and inspiriting, Im glad It the story was told.
I am not Pentecostal but was interested in the history of the movement in the US. It is well done and gave good insight into the Pentecostal movement.
Outstanding have watched 4 times and each time i learn something new

Excellent documentary.  Well-presented and interesting.  Very happy with my purchase.  In fact, I ordered this through the instant video and now I want a copy for myself.  I even told my mom tonight that I want her to see it too.  Would recommend to anyone interested in learning more about the Holy Spirit.  There is even a point in the video that encourages you to pause and read Acts chapters 1-2 in the Bible.
Excellent information on what happened on Azusa Street.

I truly was looking for some DVD on this subject...It is done nicely but I expected more.
However,the spread of Pentecost fire from here is well explained. I understand as the Director
explains it was very difficult to obtain related Photographs and movie clips of this early days.
Thank you very much for doing something to let us how it looked like and the son of slave, humble and prayerful man(Pastor William  Seymour) behind this. Yes, God does great through those humble and meek, it is proven!
I wish more and more details and research will be brought forth about the The Azusa Street in days to come

The accuracy on this appears to be close and there are a number of points that I think are worth paying attention to: I found it interesting how this recounts the growth and division of the Azusa Street revival affects.  This revival appears to have split because leaders arose that didn't accept God's order in the Church and saw "holiness" as less a priority, it seems.  Pretty interesting.
I saw part of this documentary on television and had to hear more of the story.  Very happy about this purchase.

I have been blessed! I understand now what an incredibly humble man Brother Seymour was and why he was used so powerfully by God. I felt as if I was there in the room as the Holy Spirit came....anyone who hungers and searches after a powerful move of God should watch and learn from this excellent documentary.

Although not as dynamic as I was hoping it would be, it is a good bit of history of the modern American Pentecostal movement and it's beginnings. I recommend it for anyone interested in the history of the American Church.

Thank you for a very honest and accurate description as I see it of the Azusa Street Revival. The film gives a very good overview of the key events and personalities of the revival, its challenges, and wonderful contributions to the American and worldwide church, and how it has touched millions of lives.
I guess I was expecting to much. Left me with a strong desire for more information. I would not recommend it to anyone. In fact I would not even show it to mf friends.

This one i am well please with,i would recommend this one to all my friends.
  Thank you . John Mosley

The vendor was so very prompt, I am not sure it didn't arrive the next day! I'd seen this film and wanted to share it with friends.

My complaints on the film is that it wasn't well edited. Long dead pauses and other similar issues. It has to use still photos. Interesting. The history is accurate but the film is a bit tedious and repetitive. Editing!!!!

I found this presentation not only informative, accurate and well done, but also amazing. From this very small beginning with a humble man spread a world wide revival which now is the fasting growing Christian movement in the world. Amazing what God can do through anyone who humbly submits to Him.
The historical aspect of this film is great information.  I really enjoyed the aspect of women being a part of the church as a whole.

When the Holy Spirit shows up pretty cool things happen. Loved the Narration on this film. Tells the story of the Pentecostal movement and its foundations and eventual spread. Very nicely put together documentary.
a piece of hstory to surely be cherished and hopefully relived
An absolute must see for those believing for revival!!!
I thought it was good

Beautifully done. I only wish it were longer and went into more detail. I especially like the use of the mellow voiced narrator, and the predominantly sepia tones of the visuals. It all suited the times of the narrative.
Great video very moving
Must watch!:D
Great!
Very good..
5 stars. Great film
